citation.article-title: Transfer of the misnamed [Alysiella] sp. IAM 14971 (=ATCC 29468) to the genus Moraxella as Moraxella oblonga sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Moraxella oblonga sp. nov.
Moraxella oblonga (ob.lon′ga. L. fem. adj. oblonga elongated, stretched out).
Cells are cocci that are organized in chains of ≥30 μm in length.
Acid is produced from mannitol, adonitol, inositol, rhamnose, sucrose, arabinose and maltose, but not from glucose.
Does not hydrolyse urea or lysine, decarboxylate ornithine, or produce indole.
The major cellular fatty acids are 16 : 0, 16 : 0 N alcohol and 16 : 1ω7c, and the major hydroxy fatty acid is 3OH-12 : 0.
The major quinone system is ubiquinone Q-8.
The G+C content of the DNA is 40·5 mol%.
The type strain is IAM 14971T (=ATCC 29468T), which was isolated from the oral cavity of a sheep.
